content:
Good day -- two questions

  1. Am I doing the <include>correctly to reference value sets in VSAC? see US Core Birth Sex
  2. Will the publisher support pulling in concepts from VSAC these value sets?
@Grahame Grieve - totally fine if this is low on priority list, just curious if it will happen before April 2022. If not, we may just replicate in FHIR built.
@Robert McClure @Eric Haas as FYI
it's not low on the priority list and I can't imagine not dealing with it by the January meeting
@Rob Hausam and @Grahame Grieve - Do you want us to add a note on each page where this occurring?
Just getting build errors, and want to make sure justification is clear.

@Brett Marquard What's the "here it is for your review" part? It seems a little odd to say "coming soon!!" and also "here it is". So probably I would at least finesse the wording a bit. I can see why you may want to do this. I don't know if I would (or wouldn't), but at least it could clearly explain the issue.
@Rob Hausam it would be above here: https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/US-Core/ValueSet-birthsex.html
our struggle is when we don't include these types of notes, we get bonus ballot comments to manage

@Rob Hausam That is image is a proof of concept of options for how we could manually render the expansion in case the build is not ready to provide it. Obviously the wording would be more formal. Like Brett said we don't want a bunch of confused balloters making comments because of an ig publishing issue :-)
